attributes.action: Introduce plastic alcohol glasses in clubs and bars after 12am
attributes.background: I was glassed in a unprovoked attack while on a night out. I am asking clubs and bars to introduce plastic to reduce the chance of serious injury to other members of the public. I was left with my face scarred for life, which affected my career, mental health, family and my 3 beautiful children.
attributes.additional_details:
Please read links below for CCTV of the horrendous attack and sign to stop this happening to anyone else. 

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3589464/Clubber-37-scarred-model-life-unprovoked-bar-attack-smashing-wine-glass-face-leaving-needing-50-stitches.html

http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/news/liverpool-news/watch-moment-model-scarred-life-11331136

attributes.action: Change to abortion laws in NI by amended the devolved powers the NI assembly has
attributes.background: This week a young women was sentenced to 2 years suspended for being to poor to travel out of Northern Ireland for an abortion, it is time the UK government acted to force equal treatment
attributes.additional_details: Northern Ireland's abortion laws still put women's lives at risk and discriminate against those to poor to travel to the rest of the UK, This is done with the support of the UK government and using tax payments from the rest of the UK as such the UK government should amend Northern Ireland's devolved powers or use alternative legislation to force the Northern Irish assembly to treat women and their right to an abortion equally to the rest of the UK

attributes.action: Get Hyperbaric Oxygen Therapy on the NHS for Fibromyalgia sufferers.
attributes.background:
Fibromyalgia, is a condition that causes widespread pain all over the body.
There are many other symptoms that can affect a person with Fibromyalgia: fatigue, muscle stiffness, difficulty sleeping, problems with mental processes (known as "fibro-fog"), depression, headaches and many more
attributes.additional_details:
There are few available treatments that actually help people with Fibromyalgia.  Side effects from tablets can make it difficult for people to work and can cause additional issues. 
Hyperbaric Oxygen Therapy (HBOT) really helps those with Fibromyalgia and allows a person to live a relatively normal life. It's simply a treatment of breathing pure oxygen under a pressurised condition at a diving depth that works for the individual. 
HBOT should be available on the NHS for Fibromyalgia sufferers.

attributes.action: A full review of the staffing shortages within NHS district nursing service.
attributes.background: People prefer to recover at home. The district nursing service, with the reductions in staffing since 2003 is at breaking point. District nurses are now critically endangered health professionals says the royal college of nursing and 10,000 front line staff are required.
attributes.additional_details:
There has been large cuts to the district nursing service, senior nursing sisters who require the specialist practitioner degree have been reduced in numbers and in high demand with many jobs advertised for months waiting to be filled.
District nurses will dissappear by 2025.
Only 37% of time spent dealing with patients. 
2003 - 2013 47% drop in staff from 12,620 to 6,656. Ref: Royal College of Nursing.
We want the government to debate this and commit to recruiting front line staff required.

attributes.action: Hold a second referendum on leaving the EU once exit terms have been negotiated.
attributes.background: On 23rd June 2016, the UK voted to leave the EU. The terms of the departure have yet to be agreed with the EU, and the possibilities vary widely on key issues such as access to the single market and limiting immigration. Once terms are agreed, a second vote should be held to confirm the decision.
attributes.additional_details:
During campaigning ahead of the EU referendum, many parties, including politicians and supporters on both sides of the debate, noted that the structure of any agreement to leave was uncertain. The terms that the UK would negotiate with the EU were subject to claim and counter-claim on both sides.

The public, therefore, were not aware of the full nature of the 'leave' outcome at that time and should be given the opportunity to vote on again once an agreement with the EU is reached.

attributes.action: Prevent the sale of the Royal Bank of Scotland at a loss to the taxpayer
attributes.background: According to analysis of figures published by the Government on Wednesday (16th March) by Sky News, the Government are potentially planning on selling their shares in RBS at a massive £20bn loss to the taxpayer. But we don't have to accept this loss because they don't have to sell.
attributes.additional_details:
Sky News: http://news.sky.com/story/1661144/taxpayers-face-20bn-loss-on-rbs-share-sales
Move Your Money: http://moveyourmoney.org.uk/budget-2016/

attributes.action: Make it illegal to harass those engaged in legal fieldsports.
attributes.background: For decades now those involved in legal fieldsports (hunting, shooting, fishing, trapping, etc.) have been subjected to a barrage of abuse, both verbally and more increasingly, physically by 'hunt saboteurs'.  This harassment of those involved in legal fieldsports should be made an offence.
attributes.additional_details:
In the US they have Hunter Harassment Laws, these include: 

"Impeding or obstructing a person who is engaged in lawful hunting, fishing or trapping. This could include trying to get in the way of a sportsman." 

"Impeding or obstructing a person who is engaged in a lawful activity."

It's also an offence to scare away game so it can't be hunted.

We need similar laws in the UK to stop the harassment of those participating in legal fieldsports activities.

attributes.action: Stop the boundary changes
attributes.background: The Goverment are about to introduce political boundary changes, which could see the Tory party in power indefinately, with very little possible opposition. This is a cynical attempt at power grabbing, and an affront to democracy, which must not go ahead.
attributes.additional_details: These boundary changes will see the Labour Prty lose 10% of their seats, the Lib dems 50%, but the Tories a mere 4%. If the 2015 election had been fought on these changes, the Tory majority would have trippled from 11 to 33 seats.

attributes.action: Crack down on Puppy Farming/BY breeding with stricter breeding licence criteria.
attributes.background: The current criteria/eligibility and fees to obtain a dog breeding licence is making it open to everybody, we are over run with dogs and puppies in this country. Breeding is an easy option to make big money quick. We need to clamp down and start putting the welfare of the animals first.
attributes.additional_details:
Just check out sites such as gumtree, preloved, pets4homes, even Facebook....the number of adverts are in the 1000's, rescue centres are bursting at the seams - yet licences continue to be issued allowing further breeding. The welfare of the poor dogs being bred needs questioning as the needs of the dogs isn't always first priority.
This is how easy it is to get a license and the fee for a licence varies depending where you live.
https://www.gov.uk/dog-breeding-licence-england-scotland-wales

attributes.action: Increase NHS Pay in Accordance with the Living Wage Increases
attributes.background: I propose for the NHS pay to me increased in line with the increase from National Minimum Wage to the new Living Wage.  A 1% pay increase has been proposed for NHS employees as of April 2016, at the same time the new Living Wage will come in to play.  The increase from NMW to Living Wage is 7.46%.
attributes.additional_details:
I work for NHS on the Band 3 Agenda for Change payscale.  At present I earn £17495 per annum.  The 1% pay rise results in a new salary of £17669 > a gross increase of £15.33pm, subject to income tax and NI deductions.  
The increase from NMW to Living Wage = 7.46% increase.  Therefore there is only a £1.83/hr difference between me and someone on Living Wage, where before there was a £2.24/hr difference (NMW).
I propose that NHS should increase pay scales in line with 7.46% increase for others.

attributes.action: Review the Armed Forces 1℅ paycap.
attributes.background: The Armed Forces have been on a 1℅ payrise for the last few years. Although the Government made around 20,000 servicemen redundant they task the Forces more frequently to backfill they're short falls (floods, Olympics etc) while they enjoyed a 11℅ pay rise last year and a 1.4℅ rise this year.
attributes.additional_details: A 1℅ pay increase does not reflect the cost of living. The cheapest food available to a single soldier is rising by 17℅ alone with accommodation also increasing. The extra duties placed on the Armed Forces (floods, Olympics, fuel strikes, fire strikes, prison strikes etc) deserve more than the 1℅ forced upon us when we are available 24/7. Compare this to MP's pay rises against the amount of time they spend actually working it is unfair and morally wrong.

attributes.action: Vote on an early General Election before sending Article 50
attributes.background: The public have voted to leave the EU but with little indication of how negotiations will be approached. An election would allow the various Parties to set out their priorities (e.g. Market Access v's Restricted Movement) for negotiating our future EU relationship and let the people choose.

attributes.action: Search all Islamic buildings for weapons and extremist literature and items
attributes.background: As large numbers of weapons are being found in mosque's in Europe searches should be carried out in Britain to keep us safe from weapons and Islamic extremists

attributes.action: Allow EU citizens to remain in the UK after exit from the EU with same rights
attributes.background: EU citizens who study or work and pay taxes in the UK are a fundamental part of society. The UK would not be able to function without the taxes paid in by the EU immigrants. Their rights should also not be decreased if they've been paying in for years.

attributes.action: Reduce Wait for Appointments at Gender Identity Clinics for Transgender People
attributes.background: The current wait time for Transgender people for appointments and treatment at Gender Identity Clinics is regularly over 18 months. This has a negative effect on mental health; around 48% of the Trans Population have attempted suicide . Sign this petition to support a reduction in waiting times.
attributes.additional_details: Of the 7 UK GIC's, only 2 have waiting times below 1.5 years (http://uktrans.info/attachments/article/341/patientpopulation-apr15.pdf). The legal requirement is 18 weeks from referral. Once seen initially it can take months or even years to start treatment. There's often no contact from GIC's during this wait. This is unacceptable due to the effect on mental health and the suicide risk. Regular contact must be had to reassure people they are still in the system, and the wait MUST be reduced.

attributes.action: Force child cancer to the forefront of the NHS and government funding schemes.
attributes.background: We want the government to make more funding available in the fight against child cancer. Not enough is being done to spread awareness . We need more genetic testing and research. Child cancer needs to be at the forefront of our minds. These beautiful children need our help, Please, lets help them.
attributes.additional_details: My wife and I recently lost our precious daughter Poppy-Mai to a very rare cancer, it was a progressive and aggressive malignant rhabdoid tumour which progressed into a metastatic brain tumour.  More funding should be made available in the fight against child cancer, these children are our future.

attributes.action: The government and DWP  to recognize cardiac conditions are disability's
attributes.background: I am calling on the Government to recognise heart failure and other cardiac conditions as disabilities, for the purposes of working out who is entitled to disability benefits, for to long heart conditions and the disability's that they cause have been ignored in the entitlement for certain benefits
attributes.additional_details: I am 53 years old at present I had a myocardial infarction aged 30, double heart bypass aged 30 and a further bypass aged 33,  severe heart failure from the age of 30 , I have had umpteen cardiac arrests and have a implantable cardiovertor defibrillator resynchronization device , which was upgraded from an icd , because we look okay , DWP assessors think we are okay but can't see the damage inside ,  think it is time for the government to properly assess cardiac patients and their  disabilities

attributes.action: Create an independent authority to fact-check political campaign materials.
attributes.background: There is a clear indication that misinformation was spread throughout both EU Referendum campaigns. We the undersigned, urge the government to create an independent authority to fact-check and monitor the legal standard of information for all official political campaign materials in future votes.
attributes.additional_details: In 1998, the Neill Committee recommended political parties should establish a code of best practice in partnership with the advertising industry. In 2003, the Electoral Commission concluded the Advertising Standards Authority should not be responsible for regulating election advertising, but the Commission did not establish a separate Code. This remains the case today. (ASA Political Advertising 21 July 2014).

attributes.action: Hold referendum on whether country agrees with way government is managing NHS
attributes.background: Recent polls have shown that the people of the country disagree with the way the government is managing the NHS, the government claims it is carrying out what people want.  This is disputed. We call on parliament to debate possiblity of holding a referendum so the people can have their say.

attributes.action: Conduct an inquiry into the Police's actions at the Orgreave miners strike 1984
attributes.background: In addition to the Hillsborough Disaster, the public would like an inquiry into the same Police force that also policed the miners strike at Orgreave in 1984.

attributes.action: Protect UK Environment & Wildlife - adopt European environmental legislation.
attributes.background: The vote to leave the EU could leave our wildlife at risk. The EU has developed a strong set of laws that protect the environment and our wildlife. As these laws will not apply when the UK leaves the EU we need new laws for the UK that give our precious wildlife and environment the same protection.
attributes.additional_details:
Wildlife didn't get much of a mention in the referendum debate, that's a shame as it was something that Europe treasures and its laws were very good for protecting the environment. Without new laws protected sites and our countryside might not be protected unless we have new laws that make sure we take care of it. Many species of plants, animals & invertebrates are declining, the UK Government should make it a priority to do what we can to stop this.

http://www.wildlifetrusts.org/EU-Ref/reports

attributes.action: Make it compulsory to include potassium content in food labelling in the UK.
attributes.background:
In England in 2008/09 there were 1,739,443 people aged 18 and over who were registered with CKD (stages 3-5).
According to NHS figures around 9% of the English adult population are estimated to have Chronic Kidney Disease between stage 3 and 5.
attributes.additional_details:
One of the problems with CKD is that the Kidneys are unable to regulate the level of Potassium in the blood.
High potassium can cause paralysis and heart problems, your heartbeat can become irregular and you can have heart failure. If left untreated, high potassium levels can even cause your heart to stop.
The easiest way to regulate potassium in the blood is through diet, but at the moment food in the UK does not contain information about Potassium levels so it is very difficult to do this.

attributes.action: Establish a commission to limit the mandate of the Bank of England and end QE.
attributes.background: Quantitative Easing (QE) attempts to create economic growth by unconventional, unproven methods. QE has been accompanied by unprecedentedly lower interest rates on savings accounts and Government bonds.These low interest rates threaten the real wealth of British savers, investors and pensioners.

attributes.action: Save HMS President 1918
attributes.background: HMS President Preservation Trust, the charity that owns HMS President 1918, London's last remaining World War One ship, and one of only three left has been refused Lottery funding of £330,000 to secure its future and may result in her being scrapped.
attributes.additional_details:
During WW1 HMS President 1918 was a secret German U Boat Submarine hunter (a 'Q ship') shadowing the Atlantic convoys with concealed guns. In WW2 She was used to protect St Paul's Cathedral from the Luftwaffe.

The Charity's last resort is an appeal and application to The Treasury for Government funding and it is hoped that our new Chancellor, Philip Hammond who was previously Defence Secretary and aware of the importance of The President to the nation and military, will now step in and save her.

attributes.action: The Government should not proceed with plans to increase immigration court fees.
attributes.background: The Government has proposed a massive increase in the fees that immigrants and asylum seekers pay to have their immigration/asylum cases heard in court. This huge rise in fee (eg. from £140 to £800 for a hearing in court) will prevent individuals from being able to take their cases to court.
attributes.additional_details:
If the Home Office makes an incorrect decision on someone's case, this can usually be appealed in court. The fee increase will make people unable to challenge such decisions, leading to severe disruption in their personal/family lives.

Only rich people will be able to access courts, as the proposed amounts are impossible for most immigrants and asylum seekers to pay. This is unacceptable. 

http://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2016/apr/21/asylum-and-immigration-court-fees-set-to-rise-by-over-500

attributes.action: Ensure PDA is recognised, diagnosed & treated/educated nationally
attributes.background: Pathological Demand Avoidance Syndrome (PDA) was first described in the 1980s by Elizabeth Newson.  It is an Autism Spectrum Disorder.  However it has similarities to ADHD, ODD, ADD & Attachment Disorder and is often misdiagnosed.  This causes delays in providing appropriate education & support.
attributes.additional_details:
We need to ensure a national understanding amongst teaching social and health care professionals to ensure families already under considerable strain get access to the right support in a suitable time frame.  This is especially important in ensuring the right educational interventions to ensure children can continue to learn and integrate with society 

To find out more about PDA please look online at: 
http://www.thepdaresource.com 
http://www.pdasociety.org.uk 
http://www.autism.org.uk/pda

attributes.action: House or subsidise rent for MOD Royal Gibraltar regiment serving soldiers.
attributes.background: Currently married soldiers serving in the Overseas Gibraltar regiment are not offered any form of SFA housing or help with rent relief. They are paid less than UK soldiers, live in a place with a much higher rate of living and has private rental prices of 1200-1500 for a 2 bed small flat.
attributes.additional_details: In 2011 the MOD gave back most of its housing stock to the Gibraltar Goverment in a land agreement. This caused an end to marriage accommodation for Serving MOD soldiers. Thus meaning soldiers were expected to pay £1200-1500 a month for a two bedroom on a soldiers wage. Soldiers cant afford this and are either having to rent illegally in Gibraltar, live in poverty, beg for postings to the uk which are limited, live in a different country than the one they are protecting or leave the regiment.

attributes.action: Make Homosexual Conversion/Reparative Therapy Illegal
attributes.background: Conversion or Reparative Therapy is the belief that through psychological intervention a person may be able to reject their own same sex attraction and become 'heterosexual'.This destructive and prejudiced rhetoric must be condemned as it's consequences for patients are detrimental to say the least.
attributes.additional_details: As found by the American Psychological Association, people that have gone through conversion therapy are 3 times more likely to use illegal drugs, be 8.9 times more likely to be subject to suicidal thoughts and face depression at 5.9 times the rate of their peers. As discovered by  Stonewall, out of 1300 mental health professionals, more than 200 had offered some form of this therapy, with 40% of treatments happening within the NHS. Some patients are even subjected to electroconvulsive therapy.

attributes.action: Enhance democracy by ending corporate domination of the media
attributes.background: A plural and diverse media is an essential part of a healthy democracy and yet in the UK three companies control 71% of national newspaper circulation and five companies control 81% of local newspaper titles. We demand a debate on how to end corporate media domination  and how to enhance pluralism.
attributes.additional_details: We the undersigned demand an end to the domination of our media by a small number of individuals. The EU referendum demonstrated the dismal state of our democracy. Journalist Anthony Hilton asked Rupert Murdoch why he was so opposed to the European Union. 'That’s easy,' he replied. 'When I go into Downing Street they do what I say; when I go to Brussels they take no notice.' We deserve a more democratic system than this and we should set about creating one immediately.

attributes.action: Revoke the BBC's charter
attributes.background: The BBC has become increasingly biased in its news coverage.  In particular, with its pro-EU stance, the BBC does not represent more than half the country, who are nonetheless legally bound to pay the licence fee.

attributes.action: Chicken Pox vaccination part of the NHS programme.
attributes.background: Chicken pox is considered a common childhood illness, Sadly it can cause unnecessary pain and suffering to many. And some have severe complications like my 2 year old son who has to be admitted to hospital after getting a severe infection in his chicken pox.
attributes.additional_details: Please sign this petition to help give parents and children the choice to have this vaccination on the NHS. My son is a healthy 2 year old and should not have had any complications. No other child should have to go through this. Make the change today for the health and future of our children.

attributes.action: Save West Cumberland Hospital
attributes.background: West Cumberland Hospital serves the West of the county of Cumbria. Assets are being stripped from the hospital in favour of "specialising" in a PFI hospital in Carlisle. If assets such as A&E, consultant led Midwifery and Paediatrics are removed we are in serious danger.
attributes.additional_details: The nearest hospital is the PFI Cumberland Infirmary in Carlisle, some 40 miles from Whitehaven. Owing to the rural spread and coverage of WCH we need to keep it. Please see Jamie Reed MP for further details.

attributes.action: Grant section 30 order to devolve powers for a 2nd Referendum.
attributes.background: The UK has voted to leave the EU against the overwhelming wish of the Scottish People. We now demand a section 30 order from the UK Government to hold a second referendum as a result of this substantial change in circumstance.
attributes.additional_details: To hold a referendum, a section 30 order is required to devolve the necessary powers for that referendum. We want the UK Government to agree to one immediately. If they do not then the referendum will proceed under a plebiscite.

attributes.action: For every new teacher to learn about Speech, Language and Communication Needs
attributes.background: We are calling on the Government to include Speech, Language and Communication Needs (SLCN) as part of any initial teacher training package. All trainee teachers should learn about SLCN so that they are able to adapt their teaching strategies and fully support their students to succeed and achieve.
attributes.additional_details: In English Schools 20.9% of all children on Special Educational Needs (SEN) support & 14% of children that have an Education, Health and Care Plan (EHCP) have SLCN (DfE Schools, pupils and their characteristics: January 2016). Language Impairment is seven times more common than other developmental conditions such as autism (SCALES study 2016). Including SLCN on any initial teacher training package would raise awareness & allow new teachers to feel more confident at identifying these children.

attributes.action: Restore the Department of Energy and Climate Change
attributes.background: With climate change being placed under the new 'Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy', it shows us that the PM does not take the issue seriously, although its effects are already showing. Protecting the planet is a huge job, that deserves it's own department.
attributes.additional_details: Numerous floods across the UK in such a short space of time, with three occurring in one month, show the disastrous effects of climate change on people and the environment. People could not leave their homes, homes and buildings were flooded out and many citizens suffered. Without proper care and protection, many more will follow.

attributes.action: Pressure NICE to approve nivolumab to treat advanced Kidney Cancer
attributes.background: Nivolumab has shown great promise in the treatment of kidney cancer. Following the 1st meeting to review the clinical trial evidence & cost-effectiveness of Nivolumab in treating kidney cancer, NICE has said it's unlikely they'll recommend the drug for this area. This stance needs reversing.
attributes.additional_details: In 2013, more than 11,800 people were diagnosed with kidney cancer; that's about 33 people each day.  It is now the seventh most common cancer in the UK:  the fifth most common cancer in men and the tenth in women.  Since the late 1970s, kidney cancer incidence rates have more than doubled in Great Britain. With rising numbers each year, Nivolumab could make a huge difference to many people's lives.
attributes.creator_name: Malcolm Packer on behalf of Kidney Cancer UK

attributes.action: Make it illegal for any Government to appoint Directors to the BBC Board.
attributes.background: The BBC should be totally independent from Government influencing its editorial content or the types of programmes it makes. Any Directors or Chairs of BBC should be appointed by a transparent process using a public commissioner completely independent from the Prime Minister or Culture Minister.
attributes.additional_details:
"The job of the BBC is to speak truth to power. It is a public broadcaster, not a state broadcaster. It is not the Government's BBC, it's the public's BBC."
-said Peter Kosminsky at the 2016 BAFTAs 
See: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-36245724 

BBC licence fee money is money the public gives to the BBC to make programmes & content.But the Government believe it is public/tax money so they should appoint BBC Directors, use the money for other initiatives or give it to other broadcasters/newspapers

attributes.action: CPR should be made part of the national curriculum and taught to all school kids
attributes.background:
I am a state registered Paramedic of over 12 years experience.
People are dying because others have neither the confidence nor the free state backed training they need from a young age to help save lives.
Teaching CPR through school up to 16 could save many lives and boost children's confidence.
attributes.additional_details:
CPR is not part of the national curriculum. I would argue this leads to a fear of causing further harm which deters people from acting positively and swiftly in life threatening situations. 
It will cost next to nothing to train a teacher in every school to deliver basic CPR. This should be repeated each year from 12 to 16  as a refresher as part of the school curriculum. Children with then leave school with the skills and confidence to make a difference.

attributes.action: Prevent the closure of oak ward at Banbury Horton general hospital
attributes.background: Banbury is one of the largest towns in Oxfordshire and getting bigger and now they want to close another ward in the local hospital sending all the patients that use the ward to have treatment at the Jr Oxford

attributes.action: Free medical prescriptions for undergraduates of any age.
attributes.background:
The NHS only currently offers free prescriptions for students aged 16, 17 and 18 in full time education. There are many undergraduates who struggle to afford medication during their time in university. 

Medication should be free for all undergraduate students no matter what their age.

attributes.action: Remove liquid security restrictions at UK airports for operating flight crew
attributes.background: Remove restrictions on flight crew bringing liquids through airport security. The fact that pilots sit at the controls of the aircraft with a toxic fire extinguisher and an axe behind their seats but we can't bring a yogurt or water to work seems completely ridiculous and potentially unsafe.

attributes.action: I ask Parliament to debate a vote of no confidence in the current Government.
attributes.background: The recent resignation of Iain Duncan Smith and in fighting within HM Government, failed election pledges and revelations in the press that "austerity cuts" delibrately targeted non Tory Voters it is time that the the Fixed-term Parliaments Act 2011 was enacted and a vote of no confidence is raised.
attributes.additional_details:
A no confidence vote was last successfully used on 28th March 1979, when the minority government of James Callaghan was defeated in a confidence motion which read "That this House has no confidence in Her Majesty's Government". 

Before 1979 the last successful motion of no confidence occurred in 1924.

This current government is no longer fit for purpose or fit to run our country.

attributes.action: Repeal SI 138 and allow exempted dogs who pose no danger, to live with keepers.
attributes.background: Repeal SI 138 and allow courts to add a suitable keeper at any point for any reason.  SI 138 does not protect the public - it kills dogs for the sake of killing dogs.
attributes.additional_details: If deemed to be of "type" a dog must pose no danger to be exempted. The courts assess the owner and/or keeper to ensure they are a fit and proper person. They ensure premises are secure. Defra brought in SI 138 stating  a dog that cannot live with its registered owner/keeper must be destroyed unless that owner/keeper dies or is seriously ill. This means friendly dogs who have people who are suitable to care for them  must die. This is not protecting the public. Reopen Keepership and repeal SI 138

attributes.action: Northern Ireland Border Poll for United Ireland in the EU in response to Brexit
attributes.background: The majority of people in northern ireland voted to remain in Europe during the "brexit" referendum.  Northern Ireland's decision has been discounted.  It is our democratic right to decide the future of our Island through a poll on whether to unite the Ireland and remain in the EU.
attributes.additional_details: The UK no longer has the best interests of the people of Northern Ireland in its heart. The willingness of the English people to leave the European Union goes against the wishes of the Northern Irish population therefore it is time to reevaluate our relationship and union with the United Kingdom. It is time to turn to our own island and its population, north and south of the border, to plan for a future out of the United Kingdom and in the EU, to forge a new future for the people of Ireland.

attributes.action: Change the colour of all newly issued passports back to blue.
attributes.background: Now that the United Kingdom is leaving the European Union, it would be good to move back to the original 'old blue' colour for the cover, which was replaced by burgundy in the period 1988-93.

attributes.action: Airlines to allow designated wheelchair accessible spaces on commercial flights
attributes.background: My Son and many many others like him cannot access air travel as he needs to remain in his wheelchair at all times. To transfer a young adult from his chair to a seat requires a hoist, furthermore the seat is not designed to meet his posture and he will be in major discomfort whilst flying.
attributes.additional_details: The current Act prohibits commercial airlines from discriminating against passengers with disabilities. However it has no provision to protect the rights of those who,because of their disabilities and for safety reasons, cannot sit in a standard airline passenger seat so must remain seated in their personal wheelchairs like my son. he is prevented to travel except by land vehicles,trains,or ships.This is a blatant breach on their civil rights and access to affordable and expedient transportation

attributes.action: Stop the Selloff of Channel 4.
attributes.background: Channel 4 is a PSB broadcaster, which has produced high quality programming for the last 33 years, and is an important supporter of the British film industry. If the government sells it off as they plan to the British television industry will deteriorate, will become another channel 5.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-34354216 
http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/channel-4-privatisation-would-be-an-ideological-fire-sale-labour-says-10516499.html 
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/finance/newsbysector/mediatechnologyandtelecoms/media/11671049/SUNDAY-INTERVIEW-Channel-4-chief-David-Abraham-prepares-for-privatisation-battlechannel-4-humans-david-abraham.html 
http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/2015/11/08/channel-4-privatisation-snp-john-nicolson_n_8504430.html

attributes.action: Give England a referendum on whether we want to keep Scotland in the UK
attributes.background:
Scotland had the opportunity to vote on whether they wished to stay in the UK. 
Scotland enjoys free university education, free prescriptions, better pensions than us etc all of which we pay for.  If we vote to leave the EU they say they will hold another referendum in Scotland to leave the UK
attributes.additional_details:
In the recent vote in Parliament the SNP prevented us from having the same extended shop opening hours that they already have in Scotland 
IT IS NOW TIME TO GIVE ENGLAND A VOTE ON WHETHER WE WANT SCOTLAND TO REMAIN PART OF THE UK AND STOP THE BEST OF BOTH WORLDS THAT THEY CURRENTLY ENJOY AT OUR EXPENSE

attributes.action: Improve safety legislation for coaches so no more children get injured
attributes.background: Two years ago our son almost died when he fell out of a faulty door on a coach at 60 mph.  It has highlighted to us that safety legislation is only applied to newer coaches and operators can hide the age of coaches behind private plates. This is a dangerous combination that needs to change.
attributes.additional_details:
Improved legislation is needed.
If safety legislation is passed this should apply to all coaches, not just ones manufactured from that date.
Operators should not be able to hide the age of their coaches behind private plates and there should be a far better system of visibility and transparency over the age of the coach, the level of safety equipment it has and the licence history of the operator. Otherwise you really have no idea what kind of coach your child is getting on or how safe it is!

attributes.action: Bookmakers to accept all legitimate bets up to and including £25
attributes.background: It has become a common practice for bookmakers within the UK and that operate in the UK to restrict or close the accounts of successful punters. Everyday, countless accounts are closed because of punters searching out best odds on comparison sites and selecting more winners than losers.
attributes.additional_details:
Other licence operators around the world are recognising this has become an issue, most recently New South Wales introduced more stringent regulations than those we ask for in this petition.
 
The petitioners want to see the following:
 
Bookmakers must accept a legitimate stake up to £25 on all accounts, and restrictions must not restrict to under £25. Bookmakers also be banned from closing accounts of successful punters or refuse to accept a new account.
